# Stealth VM Setup Guide## OverviewThis GitHub Actions workflow creates a free Windows VM with RDP access using GitHub's infrastructure. The VM is ephemeral (lasts ~6 hours) but includes an auto-heal system that syncs state to cloud storage every 30 minutes.## Features- ✅ Free Windows VM via GitHub Actions- ✅ RDP access via Ngrok tunnel- ✅ Auto-heal state sync (every 30 minutes)- ✅ Stealth measures to avoid detection- ✅ Manual or scheduled triggers- ✅ Up to 6 hours runtime per session---## Setup Instructions### Step 1: Configure GitHub SecretsGo to your repository Settings > Secrets and variables > Actions, then add:#### Required Secrets:**1. NGROK_AUTHTOKEN**- Sign up at https://ngrok.com (free tier)- Get your auth token from https://dashboard.ngrok.com/get-started/your-authtoken- Add as secret: \NGROK_AUTHTOKEN\**2. RCLONE_CONFIG**- This configures your cloud storage (Google Drive, OneDrive, TeraBox, etc.)- Install rclone locally: https://rclone.org/downloads/- Run: \clone config\ and create a remote called "remote"- Find config file location: \clone config file\- Copy entire contents of config file- Add as secret: \RCLONE_CONFIG\**Example Rclone Config for Google Drive:**\\\[remote]type = drivescope = drivetoken = {"access_token":"...","token_type":"Bearer",...}team_drive = \\\**3. VM_PASSWORD** (Optional)- Set a custom RDP password- Default: \StealthVM2026!\- Add as secret: \VM_PASSWORD\---### Step 2: Verify Workflow FileThe workflow file should be at: \.github/workflows/stealth-vm.yml\Check that it exists:\\\powershellTest-Path .github/workflows/stealth-vm.yml\\\---### Step 3: Manual Trigger (First Boot)1. Go to your repository on GitHub2. Click **Actions** tab3. Select **Stealth VM - Free Windows RDP** workflow4. Click **Run workflow**5. Select duration (1-6 hours)6. Click **Run workflow**---### Step 4: Get RDP Connection Details1. Go to the running workflow2. Click on the **Setup Ngrok Tunnel** step3. Look for output like:   \\\   ==========================================   RDP CONNECTION DETAILS   ==========================================   Ngrok URL: tcp://0.tcp.ngrok.io:12345   Username: runneradmin   Password: [Check secrets]   ==========================================   \\\---### Step 5: Connect via RDP**Windows:**1. Open Remote Desktop Connection (mstsc.exe)2. Enter the Ngrok URL (e.g., \
